meanings.definition: A period of time spent waiting at an airport between connecting flights.
meanings.sent1: During long layovers, people often explore the airport shops.
meanings.sent2: My layovers in Chicago are usually short and hectic.
meanings.sent3: The layovers turned into a fun adventure as we discovered a hidden food court.
meanings.sent4: The layovers felt like pauses in a fast-paced movie, allowing me to catch my breath.
meanings.sent5: The layovers seemed endless, like a never-ending game of waiting.

meanings.definition: A temporary stop or break in a journey.
meanings.sent1: The small town served as a layover before continuing the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The layovers on our road trip were refreshing breaks from driving.
meanings.sent3: The layovers became mini-vacations, exploring new places along the way.
meanings.sent4: The layovers acted like commas in the long sentence of our journey.
meanings.sent5: The layovers were like punctuation marks, adding rhythm to our travel story.
